data.actual_result: That text is as long as you want.
data.expected_result: **Either:** Discord finds the real emoji name via headers on the image or a seperate request **Or:** Discord constrains the text length of that field.
data.short_description: Nitro emoji that aren't on a shared server can be given infinitely long client-side names
data.steps_to_repro: - Have Discord Nitro - Find an emoji ID (example: 414542501043765258) - Go to a different server. - Send a message there like so: `<:here_you_can_put_whatever_you_want:414542501043765258>` - Have a different member of that server report what they see when they hover over the emoji in chat. - Instead of the real emoji name, they will see `here_you_can_put_whatever_you_want`, and that can be text as long as you want. - **Note:** If the person hovering over the emoji shares the server that the emoji's on, they'll see the real name.
